intro: Cestrum terminale var. latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its showy, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers that bloom at night. The plant has opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are broad and glossy. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, toxic seeds.
